bug.author: rawkintrevo
bug.summary: `@register_model_architecture` does not register model as expected.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior (always include the command you ran): When following <denchmark-link:https://fairseq.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tutorial_simple_lstm.html>https://fairseq.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tutorial_simple_lstm.html</denchmark-link> we register a model with however when we run <denchmark-code>fairseq-train data-bin/test01 \ --arch my_model \ </denchmark-code>
yields: fairseq-train: error: argument --arch/-a: invalid choice: 'my_model' <denchmark-h:h4>Code sample</denchmark-h>
following the tutorial is a sufficient code sample. <denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
We expected my_model to be an available architecture <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
fairseq Version (0.8.0): PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0) OS (e.g., Linux): Ubuntu 18.04 How you installed fairseq (pip, source): pip (I think?) Python version: 3.6 CUDA/cuDNN version: not applicable GPU models and configuration: Any other relevant information:
<denchmark-h:h3>Additional context</denchmark-h>

comments.comment:
I expect by the lack of other issues on this either
I have missed some obvious step No one ever registers their own models
Most likely 1.
As expected, I missed an obvious step- namely, that the file must exist in fairseq/models/* Closing and sorry for bothering you.
Can you specify the part that you missed? I am facing the same error and I can't find the part about that the file must exist in a certain directory

Wherever your fairseq is installed, there is a directory called models. You need to put your code in that directory. It's in this file: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/blob/master/docs/tutorial_classifying_names.rst>https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/blob/master/docs/tutorial_classifying_names.rst</denchmark-link>
Do a Ctrl+F for fairseq/models and you'll see the part.
